name: Terra Rossa
description:
Rio Terra Rossa is a very steep mountain creek, which is located at the beginning of Val Dogna, one of the most wild and inaccessible places in the western Julien Alps. In the canyon we can find some nice rope descents and pure green pools, which are sometimes filled with gravel, depending on the conditions. Approach is not long but it is complicated and exposed at some places. We recommend this canyon to all those who are eager for a more adventurous approach to canyoning and those who love a wild environment.

Zone: Italy – Friuli – Val Dogna

Dimensions: Entrance: 875 m Exit: 580 m Height: 305 m Length: 450 m

Period March-October

Times: Approach: 45 min. Progression: 2 h Return: 20 min

Shuttle: Yes (but it is not necessary)

Equipment: Expedition (trees and 10 mm bolts)

Rope: 2 x 40m

Highest waterfall: 40 m

Possible exit No (not evident)

Maps: Carta Tabacco 18

Attraction: Local

Difficulty: V3 a2 III

Approach

From Tarvisio or Udine drive on regional road to Dogna village. In the village, follow the signs for Val Dogna valley, cross the bridge over the Fella river, drive under the motorway bridge and after approximately 100 meters you will find a large parking lot on the right side. Here is the parking for the first car or if you have just one car. With the second car drive back in the direction to Dogna village and before the bridge over the Fella river turn right and at the first road turning right again (sign for Chiut Pupin). Follow this steep road to the Chiut Pupin (few houses), where the road ends. Park your car on the left or right side (very small parking lot) and be considerate to the residents.

Take the marked path CAI 602 and follow it uphill past two old ruins and over a metal bridge. After the bridge you will soon reach a bad hunters path on the right. Take it and follow it to the last small concrete water coverage, pass it and continue to the small creek bed (sometimes it is dry). Cross it (here is the path very badly visible) and continue in the direction of the small rocky channel. Scramble up this rocky channel and leave it after a few meters and climb to the edge on the right. From the top of this edge, follow the animals track horizontally to the right (cut branches) until we reach a steep grassy channel. From here climb 5 meters uphill, cross it on the small grassy ledge (3 meters exposed) to reach easy terrain. From here go slightly downhill (help us with cut branches) and soon we reach the wood where the slope levels out a bit and the path is more visible. The path crosses the forest and climbs slightly to the top of a wooden ridge. From here, we go downhill along the rocky barrier to the creek bed. The approach is entered correctly in openstreetmap.org (offline versions: [1] www.openandromaps.org )

Descent

C16m: tree with rope and maillon (R)

C 7m: 1 bolt with rope (R)

C 15m: tree with rope (R)

D 10m

MC 5m: old iron wire (in good condition)

C 20m: from the iron wire (L)

C 22m: 1 bolt with ring – from boulder (C–center)

T 3m

C 10m: tree – unequipped (L)

C12m: tree – unequipped (L)

C 24m: 1 bolt with ring – hidden and exposed (L)

C 40m: 2 bolts with rope and maillon (R)

C 30m: 1 bolt with ring (R)

Little dam

D 10m: (L)

D15m: iron wire (L)

D W 250m (easy)

C = cascade D = down climb D W = down climbing and walking L = left R = right MC = hand line (traverse) T = slide (tobbogan)

Exit

At the first concrete barrier find the path on the right side of the creek, which is a little overgrown at beginning. Follow this path to the bridge, cross it and you are on the asphalt road. Follow this road downhill through a road tunnel to the parking lot.

Red tape

Background
